page.title: 19HISTORY OF BURNHAM MARKET
page.content: Although this area is known as Burnham Market, there is no such parish, and the survey area is made up of parts of the parishes of Burnham Westgate and Burnham Sutton. The parishes were more densely populated in the middle ages, and the Black Death (1348) was responsible for their decline. The ruins of St Ethelbert's Church, Burnham Sutton, are next to the village hall. This church became redundant and was partially demolished in 1771, the parish being linked to that of Burnham Ulph at that time. Beacon Hill is the reputed site of one of a series of beacon fires which were lit to warn the people of Norfolk of Danish invaders. The beacon was lit again in 1977 as one of a chain of beacon fires to celebrate the silver jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.
